> The diff coverage is `100%`.

[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17926/graphs/tree.svg?width=650&height=150&src=pr&token=eZ4WkYLtcO)](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17926?src=pr&el=tree)

##           master   #17926      +/-   ##
==========================================
- Coverage   91.23%   91.22%   -0.02%     
==========================================
  Files         163      163              
  Lines       50112    50113       +1     
==========================================
- Hits        45722    45714       -8     
- Misses       4390     4399       +9

| Flag | Coverage Δ | |
|---|---|---|

| #single | `40.31% <70%> (-0.07%)` | :arrow_down: |

| [pandas/io/gbq.py](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17926?src=pr&el=tree#diff-cGFuZGFzL2lvL2dicS5weQ==) | `25% <0%> (-58.34%)` | :arrow_down: |
| [pandas/core/frame.py](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17926?src=pr&el=tree#diff-cGFuZGFzL2NvcmUvZnJhbWUucHk=) | `97.75% <0%> (-0.1%)` | :arrow_down: |

> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17926?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [51c5f4d...782eddc](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17926?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

thanks @jschendel nice fix!

> I didn't use deque in the test I modified (though I did in the one I created). The reason being that deque gets cast to int32 instead of int64 on Windows, and the test compares against a Series with int64 dtype.

FYI you can construct using ``np.arange()`` which is platform dependent.
